info.label: Information
info.text: By clicking this button you can view additional information about the screen and its text.

navigation.label: Navigation
navigation.text: Navigation buttons allow you to move freely through the exhibition. The button on the right side of the screen moves you forward and the button on the left takes you backwards.

chapters.label: Chapters
chapters.text: This button opens a menu with all chapters and screens of the exhibition. You can then freely navigate to individual screens by clicking on them.

audio.label: Audio
audio.text: This button allows you to control audio.

play.label: Playback
play.text: Exhibition can be paused. By using the same button you can then resume the exposition.

progressbar.label: Rewind
progressbar.text: In the case of a screen with a video or photo gallery, it is also possible to use this bar to rewind the progress of the current screen.

keyboard.label: Keyboard control
keyboard.text:
The exhibition can also be controlled using the keyboard. 
Press 'M' to mute all audio tracks. 
By pressing the space bar, it is possible to pause the exhibition. 
By pressing ESC it is possible to close all interactive elements displayed on the screen. 
By pressing the arrows forward or it is possible to scroll back through the exhibition. 
It is also possible to start the exhibition by pressing Enter.

dragThumb.label: Drag thumb
dragThumb.text: You can reveal the underlying image by dragging.
